title: Tiffany Calver's Big Radio Job
summary: Tiffany Calver is a DJ who made history by becoming the first woman to host a rap show on BBC Radio 1 and 1Xtra when she was 24 years old. Many people had strong opinions about her getting this job, which made her feel nervous, but she is proud because it showed she was making a change. She worked at the station for seven years, playing new songs and talking to famous music stars. One special memory was interviewing a rapper named Pop Smoke before he became very popular. Tiffany has now left the rap show to start her own program that plays different types of music. She believes it is important for more women to have jobs in radio, especially in music styles that used to be mostly for men.
